result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt A Marking

records.addlTxt: State moves to dismiss but read in case.  Court grants the motion and dismisses but reads in case.
Atty Masana received and waives reading of Information.  Stands mute.  DE advised of charge and penalty.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea.

10:38 AM Defendant Kurt A Marking in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Kurt A Marking.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.

11:13 AM Defendant Kurt A Marking in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Kurt A Marking.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE didn't waive time limits and Atty. Masana is assigned case, unavailable for todays hearing.  Atty. Dolch sitting in for Atty. Masana and hasn't looked into the case(s).  Talked with DE about time limits only. Court inquires with DE on time limits.   DE is waiving time limits only.
Return date scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return date on October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:46 PM Defendant Kurt A Marking appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Kurt A Marking.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Hayes recommends a signature bond.  $5,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or drugs.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:34 PM Defendant Kurt A Marking not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court notes records in file.  State requests warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
